communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to identify the funeral providers contacted in undercover Funeral Rule sweeps (telephone and/or in-person) and the compliance determinations for each provider, including any master results spreadsheets and warning letters and follow-up correspondence, between 1/1/2018 and the present.

To minimize any privacy or confidentiality concerns, I do not request consumer complainant identities, personal contact information for individuals, or any financial worksheets showing providers’ gross sales. If any portion is exempt, please redact only the exempt material and release the remainder.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Akash Mehta

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list (spreadsheet, database export, or equivalent record) of funeral providers that were offered entry into, enrolled in, graduated from, withdrew from, or were expelled from the Funeral Rule Offenders Program (FROP) between 1/1/2018 and the date on which this request is processed, including for each provider:
  – business name and any DBA
  – city and state
  – date offered, date enrolled, and final status/disposition date
  – disposition status (current / graduated / withdrawn / expelled)
  – category of Funeral Rule issue(s) implicated (high-level description is sufficient)

To minimize any privacy or confidentiality concerns, I do not request consumer complainant identities, personal contact information for individuals, or any financial worksheets showing providers’ gross sales. If any portion is exempt, please redact only the exempt material and release the remainder.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Akash Mehta

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All quarterly reports, summaries, or updates transmitted by the National Funeral Directors Association (NFDA) to the FTC concerning Funeral Rule Offenders Program (FROP) participants and/or missed deadlines, including any cover emails and attachments, from 1/1/2018 to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Akash Mehta
